column4: My system wont allow me to log in as any user in a graphical mode, it says that it cant get write access to the authorization file or out of space on home directory or out of disk space, whats the deal and how do i fix that?  I can log into a console
I really need to get into the system, I have a paper on the drive that I need to turn in today!!!
use a livecd to get your paper if you really need it.  Is it possible that you are actually out of space?
no chance out of space unless some hacked my box and or a other type problem vulnerability...
does it mention something like .Xauthority or .ICEauthority?
yes
delete those two files and try again
I will try, brb
that does not solve the problem
none of my users can log on graphically
good point
'df', does that say you have plenty of space left?
df reports 100% usage of my root directory
that would explain something, but what happened?
how big is your drive?
its a 120 gig drive, brand new system with nothing on it but a base ubuntu breezy install
try 'apt-get clean', to free up some space
what does that command do?
clean clears out  the  local  repository  of  retrieved  package files.
what files?
try those commands Ng and HappyFool mentioned to see what was using all the space
what command did you type exactly?  it should ahve said more
how much did the apt-get clean free up?
don't know anything about asterisk, sorry
